LOBBYINGDISCLOSURE2.printedName: Dan Holler, Vice President of Communications and Government Relations

specific_issues.description: Issues pertaining to the FY17 Budget including advancement of a conservative, fiscally responsible budget resolution, lower spending levels, unauthorized appropriations, exclusion of Affordable Care Act tax revenue and importance of a recommitment to premium support in Medicare. Issues pertaining to the need for a balanced budget and comparison of Balanced Budget Amendment (BBA) "1,070" spending cap levels to Budget Control Act (BCA) "1,040" spending cap levels.

ali_info.federal_agencies: U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES, U.S. SENATE

specific_issues.description: Issues pertaining to a conservative, patient-centered, market-based health care reform and repeal and replacement of the Affordable Care Act ("ObamaCare") to include reverting back to pre-Obamacare spending and tax baselines. Issues pertaining to mental health reform, primarily considerations of increasing Medicaid spending.

specific_issues.description: Issues pertaining to a pro-growth tax reform plan that creates a neutral consumption base, lowers rates, simplifies the code, and focuses on growth - not revenue neutrality. HR 644 "Trade Facilitation and Trade Enforcement Act of 2015," all provisions relating to the Permanent Internet Tax Freedom Act (PITFA). HR 4141 "Tax Return Preparer Competency Act of 2015," all provisions.

specific_issues.description: Issues related to patent reform that adequately respects property rights.

Issues related to opposition to closing GITMO.
